oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hempstead Mayor Dalton R. Miller, at left, pointing out the "Calderone Way" honorary street sign to a group of unidentified individuals. Photo was taken on March 8, 1971, which was the day of the first Ali-Frazier heavyweight championship boxing match. The match was shown live on the movie screens of both the Calderone and Calderone 2 (formerly the Rivoli Theatre) theaters.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hempstead Mayor Dalton R. Miller, second from left, and a group of unidentified individuals at a ribbon cutting ceremony at either the Calderone or Calderone 2 (formerly the Rivoli Theatre) theater. Photo was taken on March 8, 1971, which was the day of the first Ali-Frazier heavyweight championship boxing match. The match was shown live on the movie screens of both of the aforementioned theaters.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rivoli Theatre
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Calderone, Frank A., 1901-1987; Miller, Dalton R.; Costello, Timothy; Calderone, Mary Steichen, 1904-1998;Calderone theaters; Motion picture theaters; Theatres--New York (State)--Long Island; Rivoli Theatre (Hempstead, N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. Frank A. Calderone, at right, shaking hands with Adelphi University President Timothy Costello outside the Rivoli Theatre on May 10, 1978. Dr. Calderone donated the theater to Adelphi on that day. Also in photograph is Hempstead Mayor Dalton R. Miller (at left), Mary Steichen Calderone, and an unidentified man.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: George H. Meyer

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Calderone 2 (formerly the Rivoli Theatre)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Miller, Dalton R.; Calderone theaters; Motion picture theaters; Theatres--New York (State)--Long Island; Rivoli Theatre (Hempstead, N.Y.); Calderone 2 (Hempstead, N.Y.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hempstead Mayor Dalton R. Miller, at left, pointing out the "Calderone Way" honorary street sign to a group of unidentified individuals. The sign is located at the corner of W. Columbia and Main Streets, the site of the Calderone 2 (formerly the Rivoli Theatre). Photo was taken on March 8, 1971, which was the day of the first Ali-Frazier heavyweight championship boxing match. The match was shown live on the movie screens of both the Calderone and Calderone 2 (formerly the Rivoli Theatre) theaters.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: At the grand opening of the Calderone Theatre, Rosaria Spoleti Calderone (seated at center), mother of Dr. Frank A. Calderone, thanks Judge Jones for his many past services to the Calderone establishment. Also in photograph are Dr. Frank A. Calderone (standing at front left); Roy A. Calderone?, brother of Dr. Calderone, at far left, leaning against wall; Mary Steichen Calderone (wearing a hat), Dr. Calderone's wife, standing behind Judge Jones; Frank R. Calderone?, brother of Dr. Calderone, standing over Rosaria Calderone's right shoulder.
